description:
Natsu, Lucy, Happy, Erza, and the whole Fairy Tail Guild are back in action! And they’ve decided to tackle the “100 Years Quest”—a job no one’s dared take on since the founding of the guild more than a century ago. A mysterious town, a baffling spirit, a ghastly new enemy … and a brand new continent to explore. When you’re with real friends, the adventures never stop!

(Source: Kodansha USA)

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Dragons
tags.description: Prominently features mythical reptiles which generally have wings and can breathe fire.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Medieval
tags.description: Partially or completely set in the Middle Ages or a Middle Ages-inspired setting. Commonly features elements such as European castles and knights.

node.description:
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hiro_mashima)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCQLYbIvGWtClestisnB1_6A)__

Japanese manga artist most known for his manga Groove Adventure Rave, published by Kodansha's Weekly Shonen Magazine, from 1999 to 2005. The series was later adapted into an anime. However, the anime adaption was cancelled before it could complete the series.

In 2003, he collected some of his one-shot titles in two volumes: Mashima-en- Vol.1 & 2. Those stories include, among others, Cocona, "Xmas Hearts" and "Fairy Tail", a sort of prototype for his last work.

In 2006, he began his now finished series, Fairy Tail, serialized in Kodansha's Weekly Shonen Magazine. He also published the manga Monster Hunter Orage.

Hiro Mashima was a notable guest at the 2008 San Diego Comic-Con. He has one daughter.

His artwork and [Oda Eiichiro](https://anilist.co/staff/96881/EiichiroOda)'s are greatly similar, but that is due to both of them being influenced largely by [Toriyama Akira](https://anilist.co/staff/96901/AkiraToriyama)'s work growing up.

His former assistant was [Yoshikawa Miki](https://anilist.co/staff/98703/MikiYoshikawa) author of Yankee-kun to Megane-chan.
He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/dmpmutation)

**Shinji Ishihira** is a Japanese director, episode director and storyboard artist.
Shouji Hata is an Audio Engineer.
Tyler Walker is an ADR Director, Script writer and voice actor for FUNimation.
Mixing Engineer affiliated with FUNimation Entertainment.

[Website](https://da-ice.jp/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Da_iCE_STAFF) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCnUu_cR3-FfLEsLcAR1yhWw)

Da-iCE is a 5-member Japanese male vocal and idol dance group signed to Universal Music Japan's Universal Sigma label. They are managed by Avex Management Inc.

The group, consisting of 2 vocalists with a four-octave vocal range and 3 dancers, was formed in 2011. They made their major debut in 2014.

Despite the hyphen in the group's name, it is pronounced as "dice". Five sides of a die represent the members, while the last side represents the fans. The "a-i" in the name is intentionally spelt in lowercase, as "ai" means love in the Japanese language.

(Source: Wikipedia)

name.native: ザ・ランページ・フロム・エグザイル・トライブ

node.description:
[Website ](https://m.tribe-m.jp/artist/index/43?m=rampage_bus2016) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/THERAMPAGEfromEXILETRIBE) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/the_rampage_official/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/therampagefext) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/THERAMPAGEfromEXILETRIBE/)

THE RAMPAGE from EXILE TRIBE is a J-pop dance and vocal group from the talent agency LDH JAPAN, formed on September 2014 and debuted on January 2017. All the 16 members of the group were selected from EXILE PERFORMER BATTLE AUDITION, EXILE Presents VOCAL BATTLE AUDITION 4 and GLOBAL JAPAN CHALLENGE audition. They are divided into 3 vocalists (singers) and 13 performers (dancers). 

Prior to their debut, they performed for free in various places of Japan on a tour for 2 years as a part of training, and also participated as support members in the live tour concerts of several artists from their agency. Since their debut with the single Lightning, the group has released many singles, albums and held solo live tours. Their music has evolved quite a lot over the years, going from renegade to mellow and even mature concept. In 2019, five of the performers became rappers and formed their first and only sub-unit "MA55IVE THE RAMPAGE" (pronounced as MASSIVE THE RAMPAGE). As a part of Jr.EXILE — the collective of the junior boy groups from their agency — THE RAMPAGE has been collaborating with their brother groups in the BATTLE OF TOKYO project. They're also a part of the supergroup EXILE TRIBE, just like the end part of their group name suggests.
